definition: prodigious, a serious (or tragic) role in a play, slowly as if burdened by much weight
details:
adjective
- prodigious
= synonyms: big
- requiring or showing effort
= example: requiring or showing effort
= synonyms: labored, laboured
- usually describes a large person who is fat but has a large frame to carry it
= synonyms: fleshy, overweight
- full of
= synonyms: weighed down
- sharply inclined
= example: sharply inclined
- dense or inadequately leavened and hence likely to cause distress in the alimentary canal
= example: dense or inadequately leavened and hence likely to cause distress in the alimentary canal
- of comparatively great physical weight or density
= example: of comparatively great physical weight or density
- large and powerful
= example: large and powerful
- marked by great psychological weight
- unusually great in degree or quantity or number
= example: unusually great in degree or quantity or number
- (physics, chemistry) being or containing an isotope with greater than average atomic mass or weight
= example: (physics, chemistry) being or containing an isotope with greater than average atomic mass or weight
- of great intensity or power or force
= example: of great intensity or power or force
- slow and laborious because of weight
= example: slow and laborious because of weight
= synonyms: ponderous
- of the military or industry
= synonyms: light
- of great gravity or crucial import
= synonyms: grave, grievous, weighty
- given to excessive indulgence of bodily appetites especially for intoxicating liquors
= synonyms: hard
- full and loud and deep
= example: full and loud and deep
= synonyms: sonorous
- made of fabric having considerable thickness
= example: made of fabric having considerable thickness
- of relatively large extent and density
= example: of relatively large extent and density
- permitting little if any light to pass through because of denseness of matter
= synonyms: dense, impenetrable
- (of an actor or role) being or playing the villain
= example: (of an actor or role) being or playing the villain
- darkened by clouds
= example: darkened by clouds
= synonyms: threatening, lowering, sullen
- (used of soil) compact and fine-grained
= example: (used of soil) compact and fine-grained
= synonyms: clayey, cloggy
- (of sleep) deep and complete
= example: (of sleep) deep and complete
= synonyms: sound, profound, wakeless
- lacking lightness or liveliness
= example: lacking lightness or liveliness
= synonyms: leaden
- characterized by effort to the point of exhaustion
= synonyms: hard
- in an advanced stage of pregnancy
= synonyms: big
noun
- a serious (or tragic) role in a play
- an actor who plays villainous roles
adverb
- slowly as if burdened by much weight
= example: slowly as if burdened by much weight
= synonyms: heavily
